channel.title: Comments on: Bacon, Mushroom and Baby Spinach Pearl Couscous and Orange and Pistachio Cinnamon Pearl Couscous

item.title: By: betty
item.dc:creator: betty
item.description: oh i have this at home but just keep forgetting that i have it! im thinkin a sweet cous cous with butter, almonds slices, some knobs of sweet pumpkin, and raisins!
item.content:encoded:
oh i have this at home but just keep forgetting that i have it!
im thinkin a sweet cous cous with butter, almonds slices, some knobs of sweet pumpkin, and raisins!

item.title: By: lisaiscooking
item.dc:creator: lisaiscooking
item.description: I love the texture of pearl couscous, and it sounds delicious with spinach and mushrooms!
item.content:encoded: I love the texture of pearl couscous, and it sounds delicious with spinach and mushrooms!

item.title: By: Maria@TheGourmetChallenge
item.dc:creator: Maria@TheGourmetChallenge
item.description: Your so creative anita! I cant believe you made a dessert with couscous! And its look fantastic. I've fallen in love with this couscous, its so delicious and easy to make!
item.content:encoded: Your so creative anita! I cant believe you made a dessert with couscous! And its look fantastic. I’ve fallen in love with this couscous, its so delicious and easy to make!

item.title: By: Trissa
item.dc:creator: Trissa
item.description: Hi Anita - I love the Bacon, mushroom and spinach combination - the dish almost looks like a risotto to me! But even better because it takes less time to cook and sounds more forgiving than rice! Thanks for sharing!
item.content:encoded: Hi Anita – I love the Bacon, mushroom and spinach combination – the dish almost looks like a risotto to me! But even better because it takes less time to cook and sounds more forgiving than rice! Thanks for sharing!

item.title: By: bake in paris
item.dc:creator: bake in paris
item.description:
This looks like a very refined cuisine for me. Love to try it with the normal couscous cause that is all I could find here in Bangkok.
Anyway, the dish is really fabulous. Thanks for sharing :-)
Regards Kris
item.content:encoded:
This looks like a very refined cuisine for me. Love to try it with the normal couscous cause that is all I could find here in Bangkok.

Anyway, the dish is really fabulous. Thanks for sharing ðŸ™‚

Regards
Kris

item.title: By: Lorraine @NotQuiteNigella
item.dc:creator: Lorraine @NotQuiteNigella
item.description: Yum! The pearl couscous reminds me of tapioca or sago so perhaps a version with coconut cream and mango might work? :)
item.content:encoded: Yum! The pearl couscous reminds me of tapioca or sago so perhaps a version with coconut cream and mango might work? ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Arwen from Hoglet K
item.dc:creator: Arwen from Hoglet K
item.description: It's a shame the dessert version didn't work out, since it looks very pretty. You can't go wrong with bacon and mushrooms though - that sounds very tasty.
item.content:encoded: It’s a shame the dessert version didn’t work out, since it looks very pretty. You can’t go wrong with bacon and mushrooms though – that sounds very tasty.

item.title: By: Belle@OohLook
item.dc:creator: Belle@OohLook
item.description: I do like the pearl couscous, especially with bacon, mushroom and spinach. It's funny that it's not couscous at all, but a type of pasta. I suppose calling it 'couscous' makes it sound more exotic.
item.content:encoded: I do like the pearl couscous, especially with bacon, mushroom and spinach. It’s funny that it’s not couscous at all, but a type of pasta. I suppose calling it ‘couscous’ makes it sound more exotic.

item.title: By: Beta Gal
item.dc:creator: Beta Gal
item.description: Wow, I've never heard of using cous cous in a dessert dish before.
item.content:encoded: Wow, I’ve never heard of using cous cous in a dessert dish before.

item.title: By: Barbara
item.dc:creator: Barbara
item.description:
Interesting post and really nice presentations of your dishes.
I wondered how much like large pearl tapioca this is? Thought of it when I saw your dessert dish.
I have been making a lot of dishes with fregola- which is wonderful in savory dishes.
item.content:encoded:
Interesting post and really nice presentations of your dishes.

I wondered how much like large pearl tapioca this is? Thought of it when I saw your dessert dish.

I have been making a lot of dishes with fregola- which is wonderful in savory dishes.
